result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek C Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample prev provided per DCSO.

from SPD; no atty currently assigned; defn needs to apply

Reporter: Ann Albert
defn wants atty and advised Ct he intends to retain private counsel; Ct advised defn of right to atty and referred him to SPD/CDP and advised if he appears without counsel at next hearing he will have waived that right; bail cont'd
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Final pre-trial on August 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jordan A.
  - Defendant shall not be in the 300 block of S Main St in Cottage Grove, WI.
Trial Judge - Br 15

ADDRESS INFO for Derek C Hanson
Current: 108 Waverly Dr, Cambridge, WI 53523 United States  (Effective: 07-16-2015)
Prior: 321 S Main St Apt B, Cottage Grove, WI 53517

Defendant appeared.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.
